page.title: 01Review of the area
page.content: Wickhambrook and Lidgate are S.E.of Newmarket on the B1063.Both villages are in a rich agricultural area where cereals are the principal crops. However farming is no longer the major occupation and the work force of both villages is largely employed in nearby towns. Modern housing has blended with the older but modernized cottages. The social life however,has largely stayed in the villages so they both have a strong community spirit and co-ordinate events.There is an evident change in shopping habits, matching patterns of employment.Most local industry has gone replaced by modern enterprises.A wide range of services are provided from outside.Increased family mobility is responsible which is reflected in the fall in demand for public transport.
